intro: Gynoxys dielsiana, commonly known as the Diels' gynoxys, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Venezuela. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
